name: Synth
headline: We help AI agents learn from data.
description: You add a few decorators to your agent code, and run your agent on a dataset of questions you've generated / collected in the wild. We give you back a dataset of message triplets that's ready to be uploaded to your fine-tuning provider of choice (OpenAI, OpenPipe, Anthropic, Gemini, etc) that will give you a language model ready to steer your agent in production more effectively.

founders.name: Josh Purtell, Founder
founders.description:
Josh is the founder and CEO of Synth.

Before Synth, Josh was employee #3 and research scientist at Basis, which uses AI agents to automate accounting tasks. Previously, he built out the ML core of a Cyber Threat Intelligence SaaS product at Halborn, a cyber security startup that acqui-hired his startup Politeia. He founded Politeia while wrapping up a Math undergrad at Yale, where he did time-series ml research for fun.

generated_description:
**Synth: Empowering AI Agents through Data-Driven Learning**

Founded in 2024 and currently part of Y Combinator Batch F24, Synth is a San Francisco-based company on a mission to enhance AI agents' learning from data. With a lean team of just two, they're tackling a complex problem: the challenges of detecting and resolving errors in AI agents during production.

The idea behind Synth is deceptively simple but innovative. Users can easily integrate Synth into their systems by adding a few decorators to their AI agent code. This allows agents to run on custom datasets of questions collected from various sources. In return, Synth delivers a clean dataset of "message triplets" that can be used for fine-tuning models from providers like OpenAI, OpenPipe, Anthropic, and Gemini. This enhances the effectiveness of AI agents in real-world applications.

At its core, Synth is all about automation and optimization. Managing agent errors can be tedious and time-consuming, but Synth streamlines this through real-time monitoring and alerts. Their Python SDK simplifies integration, making it possible to start monitoring agents almost immediately. The platform learns from repeated failures, continuously improving the agents' performance—essentially taking a load off developers’ shoulders.

With a promising direction and strong backing, Synth is well-positioned to make a significant impact in the AI landscape by helping developers optimize their agents without the usual hassle.

To learn more about Synth and their offerings, visit their website at [usesynth.ai](https://www.usesynth.ai).
